mainText: The call for speakers is now open for NGVIKINGS 2019. This is a 100% community-driven event comprised of many Nordic Angular groups with more than 3500 active members in total, some of which are AngularJS Copenhagen, AngularJS Oslo, GDG Copenhagen and more. Visit ngvikings.org for more information.

Learn Service Workers inside and out with the new PWA Mastery Game, a collaborative project by geddski &  Google Developers. It's now free and it's a great resource for anyone interested in mechanics of ServiceWorkers. It is in a form of a game where the hero meets some dragons, a way to show you how to avoid pitfalls of PWAs. Visit serviceworkies.com to play the game and learn more.

There are some capabilities, like file system access, idle detection, and more that are available to native but arenâ€™t available on the web. The V8 team at Google are working on preparing a proposal for Writable File API which is designed to increase interoperability of web applications with native applications. For more information visit developers.google.com.

With release of Chrome 71, come some changes to 'cache.addAll' and 'importScripts' and also removal of SpeechSynthesis.speak if user has not activated a document. Chrome also has removed non-standard aliases for two widely supported standard interfaces. The document.origin property has been removed as well which was only ever implemented in Chromium and WebKit. For more info have a look at their release notes.

TypeScript 3.1 was released recently and has a ton of great features. Mapped types on tuples and arrays, properties declarations on functions, and version selection with typesVersions are now included in this great typed language.
